body_html: We get around this on type by making everything a function, i.e. type() returns the type, type(other_type) converts the type, type_as(tensor) converts the type based on tensor. But that's kind of ugly too.
body_text: We get around this on type by making everything a function, i.e. type() returns the type, type(other_type) converts the type, type_as(tensor) converts the type based on tensor.  But that's kind of ugly too.
body: We get around this on `type` by making everything a function, i.e. `type()` returns the type, `type(other_type)` converts the type, `type_as(tensor)` converts the type based on tensor.  But that's kind of ugly too.
